title: WALL STREET JOURNAL-BEST SELLERS
text:
Bestselling Books Week Ended Oct. 18th. 
FICTION 
1. "See Me" by Nicholas Sparks (Grand Central Publishing) 
2. "Twilight 10th Anniversary Ed." by Stephanie Meyer (Little, Brown) 
3. "The Sword of Summer" by Rick Riordan (Disney-Hyperion) 
4. "The Survivor" by Vince Flynn (Atria Books) 
5. "The Murder House" by James Patterson and David Ellis (Little, Brown) 
6. "Harry Potter/Sorcerer's Stone" by J.K. Rowling (Arthur A. Levine Books) 
7. "A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms" by George R.R. Martin (Bantam Books) 
8. "The Girl in the Spider's Web" by David Lagercrantz (Knopf) 
9. "Library of Souls" by Ransom Riggs (Quirk Books) 
10. "City on Fire" by Garth Risk Hallberg (Knopf) 
NONFICTION 
1. "Killing Reagan" by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard (Henry Holt and Co.) 
2. "The Amazing Book Is Not on Fire" by Dan Howell and Phil Lester (Random House Books for Young Readers) 
3. "Humans of New York:Stories" by Brandon Stanton (St. Martin's Press) 
4. "A More Perfect Union" by Ben Carson (Sentinel) 
5. "The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up" by Marie Kondo (Ten Speed) 
6. "The Power of I Am" by Joel Osteen (Faithwords) 
7. "M Train" by Patti Smith (Knopf Publishing) 
8. "Farmhouse Rules" by Nancy Fuller (Grand Central Life & Style) 
9. "A Common Struggle" by Patrick J. Kennedy and Stephen Fried (Blue Rider Press) 
10. "Angents of Babylon" by David Jeremiah (Tyndale House Publishers) 
FICTION E-BOOKS 
1. "See Me" by Nicholas Sparks (Grand Central Publishing) 
2. "Foreign Affairs" by Stuart Woods (G.P. Putnam's Sons)"The Sword of Summer" by Rick Riordan (Disney-Hyperion) 
3. "The Martian" by Andy Weir (Broadway) 
4. "The Survivor" by Vince Flynn (Atria/Emily Bestler Books) 
5. "The Murder House" by James Patterson and David Ellis (Little, Brown) 
6. "Wrong" by Jana Aston (Jana Aston) 
7. "The Werewolf of Bamberg" by Oliver Potzsch (Mariner Books) 
8. "Dirty English" by Ilsa Madden-Mills (Ilso Madden-Mills) 
9. "Dance Upon the Air" by Nora Roberts (Penguin) 
10. "Pretty Girls" by Karin Slaughter (HarperCollins) 
NONFICTION E-BOOKS 
1. "Killing Reagan" by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard (Henry Holt and Co.) 
2. "Think Like a Freak" by Steven D. Levitt and Stephen J. Dubner (HarperCollins) 
3. "10% Happier" by Dan Harris (Harper Collins) 
4. "The 20/20 Diet" by Phil McGraw (Bird Street Books) 
5. "The Last of the President's Men" by Bob Woodward (Simon & Schuster) 
6. "The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up" by Marie Kondo (Ten Speed Press) 
7. "Memories of Heaven" by Wayne D. Dyer (Hay House) 
8. "Why Not Me?" by Mindy Kaling (Crown Archetype) 
9. "The Outskirts of Hope" by Jo Ivester (She Writes Press) 
10. "Dancing Through Life" by Candace Cameron Bruce with Erin Davis (B&H) 
Nielsen BookScan gathers point-of-sale book data from about 16,000 locations across the U.S., representing about 85 per cent of the nation's book sales. Print-book data providers include all major booksellers and Web retailers, and food stores. E-book data providers include all major e-book retailers. Free e-books and those sold for less than 99 cents are excluded. The fiction and nonfiction lists in all formats include both adult and juvenile titles; the business list includes only adult titles. The combined lists track sales by title across all print and e-book formats; audio books are excluded. Refer questions to Michael.Boone(at)wsj.com.
